intro: Ilex robustinervosa, commonly known as the robust-leaved holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by bright red berries in the fall. Its leaves are leathery and have a distinctive, robust venation pattern that gives it its common name. Ilex robustinervosa is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
